}}'''''Where Hope and Daylight Die''''' is the fifth track of the album [[Stronghold]] by the band [[Summoning]]. The lyrics are influenced by an earlier version of the [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] poem [[In Western Lands beneath the Sun]].<ref>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://www.tapatalk.com/groups/summoning/lyrical-sources-t383.html|articlename=Lyrical Sources|accessed=26 July 2024|author=Tapatalk Summoning Board}}</ref>

==Lyrics==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
Still here I wake and I think of you
I see you far away
Answer my call
Can you hear my voice
I hear you

For we are gone and forever lost
Broken here I lie
Beneath the shadow sink
Where daylight dies
I wake for you

In better lands the sun may shine
And green leaves on trees spring
Their opening and blossoming
But here the raven sing

But still I stand and think of
Days when grass was green
And my heart was so young
They 've never been past
Forever lost
</poem>{{References}}
[[Category:Songs by Summoning]]
